subject: Psychology
title: The Rise of Positive Psychology
description: A quick win: understand The Rise of Positive Psychology.

hook.text: Psychology spent a century studying what goes wrong. Martin Seligman asked: what about what goes right?

buildup.text: In 1998, Seligman launched positive psychology ‚Äî the scientific study of well-being, strengths, and flourishing.

discovery.text: Research identified key ingredients: positive emotion, engagement, relationships, meaning, and accomplishment (PERMA).

twist.text: Critics argue positive psychology oversimplifies and can lead to toxic positivity ‚Äî ignoring real suffering.

climax.text: At its best, positive psychology complements clinical work ‚Äî not replacing the study of problems but balancing it.

punchline.text: Psychology learned to ask not just 'what's wrong?' but 'what's strong?'

quiz.question: What does PERMA stand for in positive psychology?
options: Positive emotion, engagement, relationships, meaning, accomplishment
